title: Honoring John L. Babieracki upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition by the Cathedral Club of Brooklyn on February 3, 2011
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION honoring John L. Babieracki upon the occasion of
his designation for special recognition by the Cathedral Club of  Brook-
lyn on February 3, 2011

WHEREAS,  It  is  the sense of this Legislative Body to take note of and
publicly  acknowledge  individuals  who  have  distinguished  themselves
through  their  exemplary careers, accomplishments, and purposeful lives
of service to their community and their profession; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body  is  justly  proud  to  honor  John  L.
Babieracki  upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition
by the Cathedral Club of Brooklyn at its 111th Anniversary Dinner, to be
held at the Grand Ballroom of the New York Hilton  Hotel,  on  Thursday,
February 3, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, John L. Babieracki is JP Morgan Chase & Co.'s Managing Direc-
tor for Global Design and Construction; and
  WHEREAS, In this capacity John Babieracki is the corporate real estate
executive  responsible  for  all design and construction projects for JP
Morgan Chase & Co.'s global real estate portfolio of  commercial  office
space,  data  centers and processing centers excluding the retail banks;
and
  WHEREAS, Since joining the firm in April 2005, John Babieracki has led
the implementation of the firm's state-of-art data center strategies  in
both  North  America  and Europe; in addition, he has managed the bank's
major renovations at 270 Park Avenue and 383 Madison Avenue in New  York
City as well as at Chase Tower in both Chicago and Phoenix; and
  WHEREAS,  The  270  Park  Avenue  project  is in its final stages of a
complete fit-out including the  replacement  of  the  entire  building's
infrastructure  while  maintaining  full  operations; at completion, the
project will be the largest private office building to  achieve  a  LEED
Platinum  certification, solidifying JP Morgan Chase's commitment to the
environment; and
  WHEREAS, John Babieracki also manages well over 2000  projects  yearly
within  his group working closely with a vast array of architects, engi-
neers, contractors, furniture vendors and other related professionals to
meet the demand of the business; he has committed most  of  his  profes-
sional  career  to promoting diversity within the industry and expanding
opportunities to growing companies; and
  WHEREAS, John Babieracki is a seasoned  professional  with  almost  40
years in the construction industry holding numerous managerial positions
for major national construction firms; prior to joining JP Morgan Chase,
he  spent 21 years at Morse Diesel/Amec while building a diverse portfo-
lio of complex  projects  in  commercial  high  rise  office  buildings,
healthcare  facilities,  sports  arenas,  casinos, airport terminals and
correctional facilities; and
  WHEREAS, He has been involved in such projects as the New  York  Times
Headquarters  in New York, Mohegan Sun Casino in Connecticut, the Ameri-
can Airlines Arena in Miami and Terminal 4 at JFK International Airport;
as Director of Operations for Morse Diesel/Amec, he specialized in solv-
ing complex construction challenges both expeditiously and  cost  effec-
tively; and
  WHEREAS,  John  L. Babieracki is active in construction industry spon-
sored activities and  in  numerous  worthy  organizations  and  projects
including Catholic Charities of Brooklyn and Queens, Boy Scouts of Amer-
ica, the Upper Manhattan Mental Health Center and Capuchin Pantries; and
  WHEREAS,  Born  in  Queens  and  currently living on Long Island, John
Babieracki is a graduate of Manhattan College from  which  he  earned  a
Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering; and

  WHEREAS,  With  him  throughout have been his wife of 35 years, Emily;
their children, Christopher and  Jennifer;  and  their  three  wonderful
grandchildren,  all of whom are proud of his many achievements and to be
part of his life; and
  WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by an individ-
ual  for  the  benefit  of others which John L. Babieracki has displayed
throughout his life; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance the quality of life in their community and have shown a long and
sustained  commitment  to  the  maintenance  of  high standards in their
profession, certainly have earned recognition and applause; now,  there-
fore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor John L. Babieracki  upon  the  occasion  of  his  designation  for
special  recognition  by  the  Cathedral Club of Brooklyn on February 3,
2011; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to John L. Babieracki.
